Organism_Record.Function_Summary: This protein controls the expression of at least six genes that are involved in the transport and catabolism of L-arabinose. It regulates initiation of transcription of the araBAD operon and it also controls its own synthesis. The L-arabinose operon displays both positive and negative regulation through AraC.

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with DNA of a specific nucleotide composition, e.g. GC-rich DNA binding, or with a specific sequence motif or type of DNA e.g. promotor binding or rDNA binding.
Protein that positively regulates either the transcription of one or more genes, or the translation of mRNA.
Protein which interferes with transcription, usually by binding to specific sites on DNA. Also used for proteins which repress translation.
Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of arabinose, arabino-pentose.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.

The chemical reactions and pathways involving carbohydrates, any of a group of organic compounds based of the general formula Cx(H2O)y. Includes the formation of carbohydrate derivatives by the addition of a carbohydrate residue to another molecule.
The cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA.
The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
